---
title: Account Elements
sidebar:
  order: 2
slug: shopify/account/elements
---

All the elements below are all the elements related to the customer.

Don't forget that if you want to create an account page, you just need to create a page in Webflow that has as slug **account**.

Also, keep in mind that you can use [**conditional elements**](/shopify/general/conditional) to show/hide elements if your customers are logged in or not.

## Logout Link

This link allows your customer to logout from their account. You can create a Logout link by just adding the following attribute on a link element:

<custom-attribute name="account" value="logout-link"></custom-attribute>

<copy-element name="Logout Link"></copy-element>

## Email

This is the email of the current logged in customer. You can use this element on any text elements using the custom attribute:

<custom-attribute name="account" value="email"></custom-attribute>

<copy-element name="Account Email"></copy-element>

## First Name

This is the first name of the current logged in customer. You can use this element on any text elements using the custom attribute:

<custom-attribute name="account" value="first-name"></custom-attribute>

<copy-element name="First Name"></copy-element>


## Last Name

This is the last name of the current logged in customer. You can use this element on any text elements using the custom attribute:

<custom-attribute name="account" value="last-name"></custom-attribute>

<copy-element name="Last Name"></copy-element>

## Phone

This is the phone of the current logged in customer. You can use this element on any text elements using the custom attribute:

<custom-attribute name="account" value="phone"></custom-attribute>

<copy-element name="Phone"></copy-element>

## Total Spent

This is the total amount spent by the current logged in customer. You can use this element on any text elements using the custom attribute:

<custom-attribute name="account" value="total-spent"></custom-attribute>

<copy-element name="Total Spent"></copy-element>

## Orders Count

This is the number of orders made by the current logged in customer. You can use this element on any text elements using the custom attribute:

<custom-attribute name="account" value="orders-count"></custom-attribute>

<copy-element name="Orders Count"></copy-element>

## Default Address

This is the default address of the current logged in customer. You can use this element on any text elements using the custom attribute:

<custom-attribute name="account" value="default-address"></custom-attribute>

<copy-element name="Default Address"></copy-element>
